The wine has lovely balance and a freshness that was not easy to achieve in 2018. It is dry and bright on the finish.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Domaine Charles Baur 2018 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The wine is much better than the looks of the label might suggest. It's packed with ripe flavors of sliced Bartlett pears, with that slightly grainy texture also. Though there isn't a whole lot more going on, the basic fruit is so good, clean and lingering, that it's more than sufficient as a fine all-purpose white wine.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Greetings 2019 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The wine is much better than the looks of the label might suggest. It's packed with ripe flavors of sliced Bartlett pears, with that slightly grainy texture also. Though there isn't a whole lot more going on, the basic fruit is so good, clean and lingering, that it's more than sufficient as a fine all-purpose white wine.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Greetings 2019 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: In this wine, notes of ripe yellow pear on the nose promise juiciness and freshness. Delivering on both counts, the palate presents an easy and appetizing core of green and yellow pear. The rounded body preserves freshness that brightens the dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Hugel 2018 Classic Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The shy nose on this wine keeps its secrets for now, showing only a hint of ripe pear. The palate comes in with the subtle richness of baked pear, freshness and gentle spice. A mellow fruit balance gives roundness and texture. The finish is off dry and bright.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2018 Trois Ch√¢teaux Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: In this wine, a subtle nose makes shy promises of ripe pear. Ripe, fresh pear duly appears on the concentrated palate where gentle freshness highlights the pithy, not quite zesty texture and adds verve to the fruit. The wine has lovely balance and a freshness that was not easy to achieve in 2018. It is dry and bright on the finish.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Domaine Charles Baur 2018 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Pear notes are subtle but fresh on the nose of this wine. The palate shows more ripe pear fruit that's rounded, medium bodied and off dry. It's a mellow but balanced wine.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Andr√© Kientzler 2018 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Notes of fresh pear and Golden Delicious apple promise fruity ripeness on the nose of this wine. The palate adds rounded mellowness as well as a lovely, textured phenolic edge that gives contour to the generous fruit. It is off dry and fresh on the finish.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Bestheim 2018 Anne de K. Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This pale yellow Tasmanian Pinot Gris is a smartly put together summer sipper. With delicate stone fruit, floral and ground ginger notes throughout, it's crisp, balanced and refreshing, if not exactly bursting with personality.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Holm Oak 2018 Pinot Gris (Tasmania)

Description: In this wine, a shy nose only allows a slight notion of fresh apple and the palate shows a similar subtlety. But the wine has brightness and a generous, juicy mouthfeel that leaves the impression of ripe, yellow pear. The finish is fresh and appetizing.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Joseph Cattin 2018 Sauvage Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Only faint hints of pear show on the closed nose of this wine. The palate, however, presents generous, ripe yellow-pear notes. A vein of freshness adds juiciness and a hint of almond spice.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Willm 2018 R√©serve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Ripe russet-pear notes are vivid on the nose of this wine. The palate clings to these and comes in with juiciness and a little edge of baking spices. The mouthfeel is rounded and generous, with a fresh finish.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Domaine de la Tour Blanche 2018 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Notes of fresh pear and Golden Delicious apple promise fruity ripeness on the nose of this wine. The palate adds rounded mellowness as well as a lovely, textured phenolic edge that gives contour to the generous fruit. It is off dry and fresh on the finish.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Bestheim 2018 Anne de K. Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Only faint hints of pear show on the closed nose of this wine. The palate, however, presents generous, ripe yellow-pear notes. A vein of freshness adds juiciness and a hint of almond spice.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Willm 2018 R√©serve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The generous nose on this wine is mellow with baked pear. That same rich fruit characterizes the palate where it carries an edge of marzipan bitterness. Freshness counters but leaves a rounded, full-bodied wine with an off-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: W. Gisselbrecht 2018 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Generous ripeness is already apparent on the juicy, almost tropically inflected notes of pear on the nose of this wine. Juicy, mellow and fresh, the palate comes with creaminess that accentuates the richness. The finish is off dry and mellow.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Allimant-Laugner 2018 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The closed nose on this wine reveals only the slightest hint of pear peel. Next the palate comes in with textured, pleasant pithiness and slight bitterness that works well within the full-fruited pear generosity. The finish is dry and fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Pierre Sparr 2018 Grande R√©serve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: High Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: A charming floral aroma and abundant honeydew-melon flavors give this medium-bodied wine plenty to like. A nicely rounded texture is braced by subtle acidity for a clean mouthfeel.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Brassfield 2019 High Serenity Ranch Pinot Gris (High Valley)

Description: The richness of the ripe pear fruit becomes apparent on the generous nose of this wine. The palate gives full rein to this rounded pear generosity, amplified by medium sweetness. The richness remains balanced and fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Cave de Ribeauvill√© 2017 Collection Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Freshness and the fruity ease of ripe pear show on the nose of this wine. The palate completes the picture with ripe and bright pear fruit. There is something summery and bright about this, despite the full-bodied generosity. The finish is dry and vivid.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Gustave Lorentz 2019 R√©serve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Vivid notes of melted butter and baked pear on the nose of this wine immediately spell richness. The palate delivers and adds aromatic baking spices as well as an almond bitterness. This wine offers rounded, mellow but dry richness.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Jean-Louis & Fabienne Mann 2017 Eguisheim Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Smooth fruit flavors of pear and peach come with a spicy, lightly peppery kick. This was fermented entirely in stainless steel, and has enough bottle age to be approaching its best drinking window.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Compton Family 2018 Garden Series Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Hints of ripe, yellow pear just peek through on the shy nose of this wine. The palate sweeps in with the ripe juiciness of yellow pear, adding lovely phenolic pithiness that provides texture and direction. Subtle freshness highlights the beautifully dry and concentrated finish.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Domaines Schlumberger 2018 Les Princes Abb√©s Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A subtle hint of aromatic Williams pear flashes on the otherwise shy nose of this wine. Sweeping in with juicy fruitfulness, the palate presents abundant ripe, yellow pear that captures the generosity of 2018. The finish is just off dry and vividly fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Domaine Jean Sipp 2018 R√©serve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The subtle nose on this wine combines ripe yellow apple and green pear. An almost zesty, green-pear-peel freshness on the palate provides texture. It's a vividly fresh and balanced wine with an off-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Domaine Robert Klingenfus 2019 Signature Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Pure notes of green Conference pear are evocative on the nose of this wine. They become more intense on the palate and seem to gain ripeness. A pithy texture adds richness to the ripeness and generosity. The finish is fresh and dry.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Lucien Albrecht 2019 Cuv√©e Romanus Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Subtle notes of ripe and mellow baked pear appear gently on the nose of this wine. The palate also presents this mix of freshness and roundness, adding juiciness to boost the fruit. It is off dry and appetizing on the finish.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2018 Les Natures Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Gentle notes of ripe yellow pear on the nose of this wine promise juiciness. The palate delivers with rounded, bouncy pear fruit on a body that is juicy and just about off dry. With a lovely balance of freshness and fruit, the wine has a lasting finish.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Boeckel 2018 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Gentle notes of ripe, juicy russet pear rise from the glass. The palate of this wine comes in with gentle roundness, framing the ripe pear with generosity. Subtle freshness counters the mellow finish.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Cave de Cleebourg 2017 Grande R√©serve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The gentle freshness of green but ripe pear plays subtly on the nose of this wine. Continuing in this bright vein, the palate adds mellow fruitiness. The effect is juicy and rounded, but all remains fresh. It is off dry and bright on the finish.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Cave du Roi Dagobert 2018 D√©couverte Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Showing definite sweetness on the palate, this skirts the border of off dry. Honey, ripe pears, peaches and a streak of vanilla complete a full-bodied, well-rounded and fruit-forward style. It would be interesting to try this with a slice of peach pie or pear tart.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: C√≥ria 2019 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: The closed nose on this wine gives next to nothing away. However, the palate presents a juicy flow of pear fruitiness. The body is mellow and fresh. Underneath flashes of orange juiciness lead to a just-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Frey-Sohler 2018 Rittersberg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The closed nose on this wine gives next to nothing away. However, the palate presents a juicy flow of pear fruitiness. The body is mellow and fresh. Underneath flashes of orange juiciness lead to a just-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Frey-Sohler 2018 Rittersberg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The shy nose on this wine gives away nothing but a hint of freshness. On the palate, ripe, pear-fruited generosity becomes apparent. The finish has a lovely apple-pip note and freshness.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Joseph Cattin 2018 Grand C R√©serve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Creamy, almost buttery notes of pear dominate the nose on this wine and give a sense of richness. The creaminess continues on the rounded, mellow palate that has a distinct sense of maple-syrup spice and almond bitterness. This mellow, generously fruited and spiced wine comes together on the medium-sweet finish.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2018 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Showing definite sweetness on the palate, this skirts the border of off dry. Honey, ripe pears, peaches and a streak of vanilla complete a full-bodied, well-rounded and fruit-forward style. It would be interesting to try this with a slice of peach pie or pear tart.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: C√≥ria 2019 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Vivid notes of baked pear and pear compote immediately fill the nose on this wine. The palate capitalizes on this fruit with mellow, flowing juiciness delivered in a light package. The finish is off dry and fruity.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Jean Biecher & Fils 2019 R√©serve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The nose on this wine is shy, offering mellow notes of ripe pear. These become more pronounced on the rounded palate where generosity and freshness create good balance. The finish is off dry and fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Domaine Specht 2018 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Cienega Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's an alkaline streak across the nose of this bottling, which offers dried honeysuckle and lanolin aromas as well. Dried lemon peel and quinine elements show on the palate, which is likely to blossom into other flavors with time.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Eden Rift 2018 Terraces Pinot Gris (Cienega Valley)

Description: Invitingly crisp and floral, this white wine is tropical with a fleshy opulence and lasting note of sweet vanilla.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Folie √† Deux 2019 Pinot Gris (Sonoma Coast)

Description: Faint hints of mellow baked apple appear gently on the nose of this wine. Brimming with juiciness, the palate presents ripe yellow apple and luscious pear. The finish is medium dry and full of rich, mellow fruit.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Domaine Roland Schmitt 2018 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The color is a light tawny straw, and the aromas have a pleasantly dusty spiciness. The fruit reflects the flavors of early oxidation, with autumnal apples and hints of pollen and clover. It's quite nice but should be consumed over the next year or two.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Montinore 2018 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A solid, fruity wine, this mixes crisp apple and white-peach flavors. It continues along that path and into a finish that displays some phenolic bite and skin tannins.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Alexana 2019 Terroir Series Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Broad, palate-coating flavors of lemon cake lead a smooth and lightly spicy wine. There's a suggestion of mashed pears also. The wine was fermented and aged in stainless, and kept on the lees for a full year.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Pebblestone 2018 Ellis Vineyards Block 1 Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Description: A subtle hint of yellow pear is all that can be discerned on the nose of this wine. The palate, however, comes in with ease and brightness. A juicy, balanced midpalate leads to an off-dry but vividly fresh finish.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Henri Schoenheitz 2018 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Broad, palate-coating flavors of lemon cake lead a smooth and lightly spicy wine. There's a suggestion of mashed pears also. The wine was fermented and aged in stainless, and kept on the lees for a full year.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Pebblestone 2018 Ellis Vineyards Block 1 Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Ripe pear fruit, drizzled with a squeeze of lemon, incorporates a subtle grainy, fleshy mouthfeel. It's clean and straightforward, a solid example of classic Oregon Pinot Gris. Drink over the next two vintages while it's at its freshest.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Apolloni 2019 Estate Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Only subtle hints of pear ripeness appear on the shy nose of this wine. The palate comes in with ease but also with brightness. Pear notes have an earthy tinge and a textured mouthfeel while the finish remains dry and fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Fr√©d√©ric Mallo 2018 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Subtle fruity freshness on the nose of this wine sets a vivid tone. The rounded palate is juicy and mellow, and comes together on a medium-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Koenig Vins Alsace 2018 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Vivid, generous notes of baked apple and pear abound on the nose of this wine. The medium-sweet palate continues this apple and pear theme and adds a creamy, spicy element so that the overall effect suggests pear crumble. It's a rounded, generous wine with tons of fruit.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Armand Hurst 2018 Baronne Tonia de Turckheim Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Notes of juicy yellow pear dominate the nose on this wine. The palate comes in with a light, easy step that seems weightless and refreshing. The gentle fruity flavors lead to a dry, fresh finish.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Domaine G. Metz 2018 Cuv√©e Melody Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The nose on this wine brims with notes of honeyed pear crumble and baked apple, signaling sweetness from the start. On the palate, rounded, medium-sweet richness illuminates every nuance of that ripe pear fruit. The body is fresh and mellow, and the finish medium sweet and rich.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Domaine Michel Fonne 2018 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The nose on this wine is chock-full of ripe, juicy pear fruit. Conveying equal juiciness, the rounded and fruity palate has just a little pithiness. The finish is fresh and fruity.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Domaine Zinck 2018 Portrait Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A whiff of green pear comes and goes on the shy nose of this wine. Notions of russet-pear peel and a pithy texture show on the palate. The mouthfeel is rich and rounded, and the generous fruit is countered by freshness on the off-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Robert Karcher et Fils 2018 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Despite swirling, the closed nose on this wine is not ready to give much away. On the palate, the roundness and juiciness of ripe pear gets proper billing. This wine is easy and generous, with a medium finish that leaves just the right balance.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Ruhlmann 2018 T√™te de Cuv√©e Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Easy notes of baked pear fill the nose on this wine. The palate comes in with the same mellowness, presenting generous pear fruit, rounded freshness and an off-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Philippe Sohler 2018 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: In this wine, a very shy nose reveals just a hint of pear. The palate presents itself in a similarly muted fashion, showing some pear fruit and freshness, with a mellow, juicy mouthfeel. The finish is dryish but fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Anne & Marc Wassler 2018 Vieilles Vignes Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The aromas of whole pear, wet stone and apple are followed by light bright pear flavors. It's a straight-down-the-fairway offering of this variety, with acid driving it.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Primarius 2019 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Despite its age, this wine is a bit reductive out of the gate. Aromas of cut apple and melon lead to medium-sweet full-bodied oxidized red-apple flavors. It doesn't have the acid to balance the sugar.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Convergence Zone 2017 Drizzle Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Pinot Gris (Red Mountain)

Description: Swiss-born Hans Herzog's Old World-style wines, made from his 26 organically farmed grape varieties, sing of both the land and the man. Ultralow yields and long skin contact make this amber wine‚Äîthe color of a flaming, pink-tinted sunset‚Äîextraordinarily unique in New Zealand. The evocative nose smells like a summer evening: grilled nectarines and figs, honeysuckle, beeswax and warm stones. It's gorgeously complex and mineral, with layers of flavor and texture. The alcohol is a touch high, but overall it pulses with energy, unfurling over time and proving Pinot Gris capable of greatness Down Under. Drink now‚Äì2030.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Hans Family Estate 2017 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This wine is really substantive. It's alive with mineral and fresh-bread aromas, tangy fruit and dried meat flavors, and offers lively acidity to support the depth of flavor.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Windchaser 2018 Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light and ashy on the nose, this wine starts with red and yellow apple as well as melon and intense lemon peel. There's great acidity and tension to the sip, where a river-stone minerality converges with tangerine peel and lemon rind.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Claiborne & Churchill 2018 Spanish Springs Vineyard Pinot Gris (San Luis Obispo County)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Left on the skins long enough to bring a robust copper gold color to the wine, you might call this an amalgam of white, orange and ros√© wine attributes. By any measure it's rich and delicious, with soft, slightly candied citrus peel and mixed fruitcake flavors.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Big Table Farm 2018 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Fruity and rich, this wine offers a light but pleasant oaky scent. It is buttery and textured on the palate, with flavors of green apple and melon.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: The Four Graces 2018 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: A generous wine, this is bursting with fresh, ripe pear fruit, lightly dusted with red pepper. The structure and details are impressive, with suggestions of lime, green melon and cucumber. Drink now through the early 2020s.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: J Wrigley 2018 Pinot Gris (McMinnville)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This crisp and delicious wine is packed with freshly cut apple fruit flavors. Backed with zippy acidity, the wine shows exceptional focus, concentration and persistence. This is a perfect all-purpose white wine when you need a break from oaky Chardonnays.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Van Duzer 2018 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Fresh and leesy, as is the style for all of the winery's white wines, this brings crisp flavors of apple flesh and peel. It's focused and nicely balanced, with lovely mineral highlights.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: St. Innocent 2017 Vitae Springs Vineyard Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Nutty and bright, this is a sleek, acid-focused and fresh white wine with earthy minerality. It showcases deft aromas of white flowers and citrus while leading to a core of succulent peach and melon.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Keller Estate 2018 La Cruz Pinot Gris (Petaluma Gap)

Description: This is a lovely, dry example of Marlborough Pinot Gris without too much winemaking trickery. A delicately perfumed nose of honeysuckle, hibiscus and pear leads to a palate that is textural yet refreshing, expressing the variety's gentle floral and orchard fruit characters. A touch of bitterness at the finish distracts slightly, but overall this is a solid bottling of this style from a sensitive producer.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Huia 2019 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Tones of freshly cut pear and apple shine brightly in this ready-to-drink, young wine. The fruit is the whole show here and should be enjoyed while it remains balanced and pure.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2018 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A solidly fruity wine, it's loaded with pear flesh and texture, balanced against fresh and proportionate acids. Not a complex wine, but clean and quite flavorful.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Del Rio 2018 Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The fresh pear fruit is vivid and crisp as an autumn breeze. The fruit is lightly dappled with black pepper. Though not a complex wine, it's immensely refreshing, with a slightly high-toned burst at the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Portlandia 2018 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Lovely herbal flavors adorn crisp apple and Asian pear in this wine. The overall palate impression is of an elegant, sophisticated feel, with herbal notes that complement rather than dominate.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Kings Ridge 2018 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From estate-grown fruit, this is a stony, slatey white wine enveloped in flavors of apricot and a lightness of baking spice. Low in oak, it is juicy, fleshy and fully integrated.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Balletto 2019 Pinot Gris (Russian River Valley)

Description: Fleshy pear fruit immediately makes a good impression, and is punched up with vivid acids that add a touch of grapefruit. The wine takes a deep dive into a lingering, clean, fresh finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Primarius 2018 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: This extroverted, ultrafloral wine from touristy Waiheke Island, near Auckland, won't be everyone's cup of tea. Still, many will be enchanted by its shiny, almost neon yellow color and intense perfume of jasmine and hyacinth, ginger hand soap, and honeycomb. There's a touch of sweetness on the palate, adding to its rich opulence, but enough freshness to make it easy to take another sip.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Man O' War 2017 Exiled Pinot Gris (Waiheke Island)

Description: Bold yellow-apple and lemon flavors are dusted by layers of crushed stone, nut and candle wax in this pert, dry Pinot Gris. Dry and medium bodied on the palate, it's a refreshing sip, with a tangy salt-rimmed finish. Best enjoyed now through 2027.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Friedrich Becker 2017 Becker Family Pinot Gris (Pfalz)

Description: This is an elegant, structured Pinot Gris suggesting bright juicy apple and grapefruit flavors accented by toasted nuts and waxy citrus peels. Dry and full bodied in style, it's balanced by fresh acidity and a rim of bitters on the finish.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Salwey 2016 RS Pinot Gris (Baden)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This strikes a balance among its crisp flavors of green apple, cucumber and lemon. The acids are substantial and refreshing, and it finishes sharp and peppery, with appealing minerality.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Winter's Hill 2017 Watershed Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Description: Peardrop freshness and smooth creaminess are immediate on the nose. The light palate sets a lemony scene for the freshness and that creamy, smooth texture, leaving you with a sense of refreshing, creamy ease.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Steindorfer 2019 Pinot Gris (Burgenland)

Description: This Otago Pinot Gris opens bombastically, almost Gew√ºrztraminer-like. It bursts with lemon zest and honeyed pears, waxy and woolly notes, and fistfuls of white flower blossoms. There's a lovely slippery texture on the palate, which is less extroverted than the nose suggests. A lifted line of slightly angular acidity and a finish of fruits and florals makes for a solid offering.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Wild Earth 2017 Pinot Gris (Central Otago)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This bottle is stuffed with flavors of apples and pears, varietally on target, with skin flavors adding texture. It sails into a crisp and fruity finish. There is nothing complicated about it, just good fruit well made.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Carabella 2018 Estate Pinot Gris (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Full bodied, round and fruity, this brings fleshy fruit flavors of pear and melon, with a splash of grapefruit. There's 2% Gew√ºrztraminer included, and though the back label states that it's ‚ÄúBurgundian-style,‚Äù don't look for Chardonnay-type flavors here.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Firesteed 2018 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Given a five-day cold soak prior to fermentation, this has picked up the color and characteristics of a ros√©. Biodynamic grapes and wild yeasts add interesting texture, but there's a softness to the palate that suggests some oxidation has occurred. The flavors of candied fruit veer into orange wine territory. The wine is smooth and flavorful, but it's probably best to drink it over the next year.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Keeler 2018 Skin Contact Pinot Gris (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is so light as to appear almost colorless, but it's not bereft of flavor. Lightly peppery hints of white melon, Asian pear and green apples construct a delicate palate that nonetheless offers plenty of flavor interest. The wine saw no oak and was not put through malolactic fermentation.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Provincial Vineyards 2016 Estate Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Here is a solid, almost chunky wine, packed with fleshy pear and apple fruit. All-stainless fermented, it seems to have spent some time on the lees, as the texture reflects that creamy minerality. Drink now‚Äì2023.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Wine by Joe 2018 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Fleshy pear fruit carries this appealing wine, lightly spiced and hinting at freshly picked green herbs. It's not quite as complex as the previous vintage, but nonetheless a delicious wine and a fine value.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Duck Pond 2018 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Another can't-miss effort from the Union Wine Company, this light and versatile dry white wine offers crisp pear, apple and cucumber flavors, nicely annotated by an accent of thyme. It's an elegant, immaculately fresh wine, widely available at a good price.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Underwood 2018 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: With aromas of white peach and pineapple, this wine is soft in the mouth, with flavors of nectarine, apricot and rose petal. It offers a soft citrus finish.                      Mike DeSimone
Name: Dalton 2019 Estate Unoaked Pinot Gris (Galilee)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Bottled in the type of massive, deeply punted glass generally reserved for pricey reserve Cabernets, this seems to promise something special. Fermentation and aging in French oak puncheons has helped to smooth out the rough edges and high acids, without impacting flavors. It's totally dry and low in alcohol, with flavors of grapefruit, lemon and green apple.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Aret√© 2018 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Clean aromas of nectarine and Pink Lady apple seem a bit sweet on the nose of this bottling. It tightens up on the sip, where crisp aromas of apple and pear are quite subtle, finishing with a brush of bubblegum.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Villa San-Juliette 2018 Pinot Gris (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of slate, mango, cantaloupe and papaya lead to lighter-styled, dry fruit flavors. It brings a sense of elegance, not entirely standing on its own, but as a nice accent to a meal. Pair it with cashew-crusted halibut with a mango-kiwi salsa.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Freehand 2018 Pinot Gris (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This all-stainless style is finished close to bone-dry, and the fruit lands squarely on lemon-lime flesh and rind flavors. It's juicy and quite tart, so best tasted with trout or other light seafood in a butter sauce.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Iris Vineyards 2018 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: This wine is low key, full bodied and moderately fruity, offering light apple aromas and a good, lively texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Les Belles Collines 2018 Pinot Gris (California)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is a light and simple wine, with standard fruit flavors of pear flesh and skin. As an all-purpose white wine it's fine, though generic.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Melrose 2017 Pinot Gris (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This wine is so light as to feel dilute, with generic fruit flavors that simply vanish. There's nothing wrong or off, just not much flavor.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Oak Knoll 2016 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Adam Campbell's Pinot Gris is one of Oregon's best, year in and year out. A lush and vivid mix of grapefruit, lemon curd and candied orange peel, this new vintage both surprises and delights. Such complexity is rare in a grape mostly centered around apple and pear flavors‚Äîboth are here, but in a back seat role. This unique mix is deliciously irresistible.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Elk Cove 2019 Estate Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: White melon and pear abound in this fresh, medium-bodied white. It's a juicy, unoaked wine lifted by layers of lemon and lime acidity but anchored by a subtle, smoky minerality that lingers, too. It's elegant yet effortlessly easy-drinking. Best enjoyed young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Franz Keller 2018 Vom L√∂ss Pinot Gris (Baden)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This wine is bursting with scents and flavors of pear and grapefruit. Incredibly refreshing, it's textured and leesy, with appealing minerality and a long, clean, pour-me-more finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Portlandia 2019 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Sharp toned at first, this smooths out with a bit of aeration, bringing up a tasty mix of apple, pear and lemon curd, with notes of vanilla and whipped cream. It was entirely whole-cluster fermented in stainless steel, and retains its richness through a lingering finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Raptor Ridge 2018 Vineyard Select Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The flavors mix tart citrus with bright tangerine and crisp apple. It's a far cry from the ros√©-like 2016, and much more along the lines of most Oregon Pinot Gris. Fresh and tangy, it should be enjoyed over the next two or three years.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Duck Pond 2017 St. Jory Vineyard Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: A delicate expression of this variety, this opens like a soft breeze, carrying on it lemon, orange, stone fruit and floral notes. The palate shows more personality, crunching with acidity amid bright, juicy fruit. Light bodied, this would be an easy, unoffensive white to have around the house for summertime sipping.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Punt Road 2019 Napoleone Vineyard Pinot Gris (Yarra Valley)

Description: Crisp notes of white grape and blossom perfume mouthwatering grapefruit and pear on the palate of this vibrant Pinot Gris. Dry and unoaked with a transparent fruit quality, it's a spry, thirst-quenching crowd-pleaser. Drink now.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Villa Wolf 2018 Pinot Gris (Pfalz)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pear aromas are out front, followed by notes of apple and pineapple. Dry tropical and stone fruit flavors follow. It delivers broad appeal.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Canoe Ridge 2019 The Expedition Pinot Gris (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: Demure whiffs of white grape and Asian pear introduce this very juicy, intensely fruity Pinot Gris. Full bodied and dry, it's a pleasantly grapy wine concentrated with plump yellow plum and grapefruit flavors. Drink now.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Weingut Binz 2018 Nackenheimer Kabinett Trocken-Dry Estate Bottled Pinot Gris (Rheinhessen)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a light, leesy and fresh style, keeping it simple and straightforward, all to good effect. A mix of citrus fruit flavors, notably grapefruit and lime, take center stage. It's crystal clear, clean and zesty, just a perfectly quaffable white wine.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Pike Road 2019 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Subtle whiffs of fresh pear and peanut skins are amplified on the palate of this zesty dry white. Slim and unoaked, it's a refreshingly peppy wine accented by notes of tart green apple and lime. Drink now.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Leonard Kreusch 2018 Rhein Pinot Gris (Rheinhessen)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This is tart and racy, right up to the point of sour, with lemon and green-pineapple fruit. For the right foods (whitefish in a lemon sauce, for example, or even fresh oysters) this would be spot on. Don't look for the usual Willamette Valley style of Pinot Gris; this is from the Gorge, with less body, more acid and a mouthpuckering finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Hood Crest 2018 Pinot Gris (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Description: From old vines at the estate, this offers unusually subtle spice and detail rather than just straightforward fleshy fruit. Asian pear and apple fruit are there in abundance, along with a lovely layer of caramel and light baking spices. The balance and length are exceptional.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Yamhill Valley 2018 Estate Pinot Gris (McMinnville)

Description: This small-production white is steely in apricot, apple and lemon flavors, with lasting freshness and verve. Expansive on the midpalate, it delivers light, nuanced flavors and is complex and balanced.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Thirty-Seven 2018 Pinot Gris (Petaluma Gap)

Description: Vivid and rich notions of ripe juicy yellow pear and baked pear tell the tale of the hot 2018 summer. The dry palate corrals this ripeness with its textural pithy richness, lending it balance in its boldness. This is rounded, full-bodied, dry and very fruity.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Kracher 2018 Pinot Gris (Burgenland)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Though labeled Willamette Valley, this is 100% estate-grown fruit from the Dundee Hills. It's tart and bracing, with lemon-lime fruit vividly defined by the acidity. Those flavors continue with green apple in the mix as well, and then open up with a touch of almond candy through the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Sokol Blosser 2018 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Very fruity and nicely polished, this medium-bodied, unoaked wine offers fresh peach and apple flavors and a rounded texture. A light buttery, earthy aroma starts it off before the fresh fruit moves in.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Kendall-Jackson 2018 Vintner's Reserve Pinot Gris (California)

Description: The nose on this wine is lovely and open: Orange, lime and lavender potpourri scents are all delicate and pretty. It's not quite as harmonious on the palate. The acidity is lifted and prickly but feels a bit forced, and there's a slight bitterness at the finish. But the attractive fruit and floral notes are there on the midpalate particularly.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Innocent Bystander 2018 Pinot Gris (Victoria)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is solidly varietal, with strong fruit components of melon and pear. Full bodied and fruit-forward, it's styled for drinking while young, perhaps chilled a bit, and served outdoors with a summer picnic.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: La Chouette 2019 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This wine is soft in the mouth, full bodied with ripe pear fruit, and a cottony impression. Though simple and fruity, it lingers nicely through the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: High Pass 2019 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: This offers notes of beeswax, lime, lemon verbena and an oily, herbal quality. On the bone-dry palate, the acidity is cheek-sucking and feels a bit forced. Drink now with a buttery dish to temper all that biting acidity.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Cool Woods 2018 Pinot Gris (South Australia)

Description: Lightly citric aromas are a touch dusty, while this feels round but amorphous on the palate. Pear and green-melon flavors make their point before fading on a sound but simple finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Fran√ßois Lurton 2019 Bodega Piedra Negra Alta Colecci√≥n Pinot Gris (Los Chacayes)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of melon, ale, wet copper penny and wilted flower are followed by medium-sweet drinking canned peach and tropical fruit flavors. It doesn't all work.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Maryhill 2018 Tudor Hills Vineyard Pinot Gris (Yakima Valley)

Description: Unlike some New Zealand Pinot Gris, where winemaking technique can mask varietal character, Peregrine's version feels less forced and more food-friendly. Opening with delicate notes of honeysuckle, pear and yeasty apple, plump, fleshy fruit and a viscous texture follow on the palate. The rich mouthfeel is lifted by crisp acidity, which veers a little on the astringent side on the finish.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Peregrine 2018 Pinot Gris (Central Otago)

Description: This pale blush-colored Pinot Gris is a ripe, perfumed drop, dripping with cooked pears and melon, honeysuckle and baking spices. There's some residual sugar on the palate, just enough to emphasize the fruit and creamy texture, but not enough to overpower the bright, lifted acidity.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Marisco Vineyards 2019 The Ned Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: A fruity, floral number bursting with honeyed pears, cantaloupe, white flower blossoms and a sprinkle of salt. It's slippery in the mouth but not overtly creamy, with a bright line of fruit and flowers through the front and midpalate, but veering toward bitterness at the back. Nevertheless, this is an appealing alternative to those who don't dig the greenness of Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Waipapa Bay 2019 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: Clever marketing and eye-catching labels aside, this Hawkes Bay Pinot Gris doesn't succeed in the deliciousness department as well at the label's Albari√±o does, but fans of rich, textural whites will dig it. It's a little candied and plastic at first and then offers more appealing apple and pear strudel notes with time in the glass. The palate is viscous with ripe, fleshy orchard fruit, and the acidity is enough to lift it out of syrupy territory.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Left Field 2018 Pinot Gris (Hawke's Bay)

Description: This is a rather bombastic yet crowd-pleasing Pinot Gris that billows a perfume of frangipani blossoms, honeyed pears and orange peel. It's attractive, if a little rich and synthetic. The palate is fresher than the nose suggests, although it comes with a creamy texture amid a bright line of acidity.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Palliser Estate 2018 Pinot Gris (Martinborough)

Description: This is a fruity, straightforward Pinot Gris offering up notes of cooked pear, grape juice and honeysuckle. The play between acidity and texture works, and the pear-flavored finish is appealing. It feels a little worked winemaking-wise, but has the likability factor nonetheless.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Yealands 2018 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: Though quite salty and reductive to start, there's plenty of ripe pear, stone fruit and honey lurking beneath. The palate lacks cohesion, with the sharp-edged acidity feeling disjointed from the creamy texture and the fruit losing its way.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Oyster Bay 2019 Pinot Gris (Hawke's Bay)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: The aromas offer notes of lemon zest and barbecue smoke. Quite smoky flavors follow, with lemony acidity providing the frame. There's good fruit here, and the acid is impressive, but the smoke influence is fairly prominent.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Phelps Creek 2017 Pinot Gris (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Description: Once again, where this brand excels in its Sauvignon Blanc it stumbles with its Pinot Gris. There's a lot of winemaking going on here to lackluster results. There's seemingly a lot of sulfur on the nose and palate here, and the fruit feels a little synthetic, offering baked peach and pear with some floral notes. The palate is rich and made in an off-dry style, and while the acidity is fairly bright and lifted, there's a bitter note at the finish.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Fern Ridge 2019 Pinot Gris (Hawke's Bay)

Description: A penetrating pungency amps up the herbal side of the grape here, adding the spicy character that is more often found in Sauvignon Blancs. The fruit flavors mix lemon, melon and juicy pineapple.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Maysara 2018 Arsheen Pinot Gris (McMinnville)

Description: A penetrating pungency amps up the herbal side of the grape here, adding the spicy character that is more often found in Sauvignon Blancs. The fruit flavors mix lemon, melon and juicy pineapple.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Maysara 2018 Arsheen Pinot Gris (McMinnville)

Description: Pinot Gris on skins, so technically this is a skin-contact white, although it looks and tastes like a ros√©. Don't let the cloudy appearance deter you. It's highly perfumed yet delicate, like a summer breeze that carries scents of cherries and apricots still on the tree, wild strawberries in the fields, and stones along a nearby stream. Feathery light on the palate, the wild red berries are crunchy and fresh thanks to bright acidity. A spicy, cocktail bitters flavor adds a base note. Drink chilled to kick off an evening of merriment.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Good Intentions 2018 Gris Diddly Dee Pinot Gris (Mount Gambier)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: It's a shame there isn't more of this aromatic and thoroughly captivating, estate-grown white wine. Bold Honeycrisp apple and pear fruit flavors carry a whiff of marshmallow, and fermentation in all-stainless tanks means that lovely fruit remains unshackled by any barrel influences. Drink through 2021.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Dion 2018 Pinot Gris (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This wine is 100% estate-grown from biodynamically farmed, fermented entirely in stainless steel. No oak is wanted or needed here, as the fruit is sensational, with penetrating flavors of lime and lemon.                      Paul Gregutt
Designation: Domaine Estate Grown Made with Biodynamic Grapes
Name: King Estate 2018 Domaine Estate Grown Made with Biodynamic Grapes Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a block selection, fermented in both barrels and stainless steel. Deep, delicious fruit flavors plow down with lush, freshly cut pear front and center. There's a whiff of coconut, perhaps from the barrels, and trailing notes of pepper and red hot candy.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Winter's Hill 2017 Reserve Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This baseline Pinot Gris really shines in this vintage. It's bursting with freshly cut pear that feels fleshy and textured. Juicy highlights of citrus boost the mouthfeel and add further liveliness to the finish, which ultimately resolves a papaya tone.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: King Estate 2018 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Though not as ripely fruity as the excellent 2017, this surpasses it with a crystalline focus on apple, pear and kiwifruit. It's framed in textural flavors of skin tannins, adding dimension and crisp detail through the long finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Westmount 2018 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: In 2017 the winery changed its Pinot Gris ros√© to an orange wine, with a French moniker that translates as ‚Äúon the skins.‚Äù It's a barrel-fermented wine from the excellent Lazy River vineyard. Soft and approachable, its buffed fruits hint at tropical flavors. As with all orange wines, which are orange due to intentional oxidation, this is best consumed within a year of its release.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Aubichon Cellars 2017 Sur Peaux Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: There's nothing too fancy here, but the wonderfully fresh flavors of pear and grapefruit really shine. All-stainless fermented, it shows a finishing touch of lemon zest as it fades.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Panther Creek 2018 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This all-stainless effort is fruit-powered and loaded with fresh flavors of apple and peach. It shows depth of concentration and texture, making it a fine example of Oregon Pinot Gris.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Chemistry 2018 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Fermented in stainless, as opposed to the winery's Ab Ovo, which is made in concrete egg, this light, herbal effort mixes fresh apple with herbs and a hint of white pepper. It's fine for near-term drinking.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Archery Summit 2017 Vireton Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This fleshy, fruity wine brings the expected flavors of apple and pear, here with a thin slice of orange candy. It's smooth all the way through to a clean, round, ripe and satisfying finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Capitello 2018 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Scents of lemon polish and citrus rind open into a tight but quaffable Pinot Gris with grapefruit the dominant flavor. It's modest in scale but fruity enough, although the mouthfeel flattens out and suggests it should be consumed over the next year.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Anchor Valley 2018 Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Description: This is a soft, fruity, porch pounder of a Pinot Grigio that doesn't offend but also doesn't excite. Ripe and somewhat synthetic apple, pear and peach blossom flavors are ensconced in a creamy texture.                      Christina Pickard
Name: De Bortoli 2018 Pinot G Pinot Gris (Australia)

Description: Pale gold color, this Pinot Gris is initially salty and reductive, masking orchard fruit and honey notes. The palate is slippery with what feels like a bit of residual sugar left to balance the acidity.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Blackbilly 2017 Pinot Gris (Adelaide)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Seared apple, lemon-juice, sea-salt and warm cream aromas combine toasty and fresh elements on the nose of this bottling. The palate is brisk with grapefruit-peel, dried apple and beach-sand flavors, proving quite complex for this variety, and finishing with a beeswax touch.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lumen 2018 Sierra Madre Vineyard Pinot Gris (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Effusive aromas of melon, Vaseline, kiwi and whole pineapple lead to full-bodied, well-balanced, broad-feeling flavors. It's a cornucopia of fruit, while never getting overweighted.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Boomtown 2018 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Aromas of lemon oil, crushed apple and light warm spice show on the well-concentrated nose of this Pinot Gris that sees time in both neutral French oak and stainless steel. It is rich and full on the palate without feeling unbalanced. Creamy pear and apple flavors meld with hints of honeysuckle and spice, all backed by integrated acidity and gentle waxy bitterness.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Hector Wine Company 2017 Pinot Gris (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This is a slightly off-dry Pinot Gris that offers plenty of brisk lemongrass and green pear flavors. A rush of acidity and racy lemon zest brightens up the crisp finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2017 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Aromas of ripe red apple and lemon peel are accented by earthy button mushroom on the nose. There's silkiness to the medium-bodied palate, with honed acidity lending ample support to the whole. Crisp orchard fruit and citrus flavors end with a hint of candlewax on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Lakewood 2017 Gigliotti Vineyards Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Straightforward tones of pressed apple, lemongrass and spice carry to the medium-bodied palate. It's well balanced and juicy in feel, with a waxy note marking the close.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Osprey's Dominion 2017 Reserve Pinot Gris (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Delightfully fruity and floral, this wine displays a wealth of fresh apple and pear tones alongside honeysuckle. Delicate spice and wax arise on the palate, with drawing acidity providing good focus and freshness.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2017 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Bursting in aromas of apple, pear and candied grapefruit, this is a boisterous, zippy Pinot Gris that is shot through with tangy acidity on the medium-bodied palate. It is persistent and fresh, with plenty of citrusy lift on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Bet The Farm 2018 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Cayuga Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This wine is all about ripe Bosc pear and honeysuckle, with wax lending delicate astringency. It is light in profile and lifted by a mild vein on zesty acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Hosmer 2017 Estate Winery Pinot Gris (Cayuga Lake)

Description: This spare, medium-bodied wine offers flinty aromas and mineral flavors and little overt fruitiness. It is medium bodied and well balanced.                      Jim Gordon
Name: J Vineyards & Winery 2018 Pinot Gris (California)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Fresh, zesty notes of apple peel, lemon and candlewax offer a strong start. Medium in weight and slightly off-dry, the palate brings delicate apple and melon flavors that are pushed along by honed acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Living Roots 2017 Golden Bosc Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Aromas of nearly wilted honeysuckle and lemon peel carry the nose. The palate is light in profile, with mild acidity pushing along apple and sharp citrus flavors. It ends a bit bitter on a candlewax note.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Sheldrake Point 2017 Estate Bottled Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Sharp aromas of citrus peel meld with wilted flowers and pollen on the nose. This is light in profile, with juicy pear and apple flavors giving a well-tempered showing.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Glenora 2017 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Faint aromas of pear and melon carry the nose. The palate is more explosive in nature, driven by tangy green apple and racy acidity that never relents. This is supertart and brisk.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Atwater 2017 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Description: Oily white fruit and citric aromas include a whiff of matchstick. An oddly spritzy palate is edgy, while slightly bitter flavors of green fruits and grape skins turn greener on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Apaltagua 2018 Reserva Pinot Gris (San Antonio)

Description: A soft, broad texture and vaguely fruity flavors make this a pretty neutral wine suitable for a crowd or outdoor occasion.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Parducci 2018 Small Lot Pinot Gris (Mendocino)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This wine is gushing in aromas of apple cider vinegar, lemon and wax. It's full in feel on the palate, with fresh flavors of melon and lime peel that extend to creamy pear on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Thirsty Owl Wine Company 2017 Estate Bottled Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Candied lemon peel and pollen tones meld with ripe apple on the nose and palate. This is very light in profile, with little grip or depth. It ends savory on a yeast note.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Knapp 2017 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Almost as pale as water in the glass, this wine starts off with aromas of wilted flowers, lime peel and yeast. Candied banana and citrus zest carry the palate, with mild acidity offering support to the light-bodied frame.                      Alexander Peartree
Designation: Timothy Moore Wines Siltstone Vineyard Keuka
Name: Inspire Moore 2017 Timothy Moore Wines Siltstone Vineyard Keuka Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Cienega Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's an alkaline streak across the nose of this bottling, which offers dried honeysuckle and lanolin aromas as well. Dried lemon peel and quinine elements show on the palate, which is likely to blossom into other flavors with time.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Eden Rift 2018 Terraces Pinot Gris (Cienega Valley)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This eye-opening wine is flavorful, concentrated and full bodied, clearly standing out in a varietal field full of blandness. Layers of ripe pear, fig, cream and almond give it plenty of complexity, while a mouthfilling texture and long finish complete the picture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Windchaser 2017 Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fresh, appealing aromas of apple, Bosc pear, flowers and heaping amounts of tropical fruit lead to full-feeling apple, kiwi, melon and pineapple flavors with a generous touch of sweetness. It delights.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Canoe Ridge 2018 The Expedition Pinot Gris (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of petroleum jelly, apple and cut canned pineapple lead to a flavorful, medium-bodied palate. It provides a lot of appeal, with a nice sense of acidity accenting the flavors.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Waterbrook 2018 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Cienega Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: With dynamic and complex expressions like this, it's a wonder why people started stripping the naturally pink hue that Pinot Gris provides. The pinkish orange wine delivers aromas of strawberry sorbet and rosebuds and then opens onto a palate of light raspberry and watermelon. There is ample tannic tension as well.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: I. Brand & Family 2018 Eden Rift Vineyard Pinot Gris (Cienega Valley)

Description: Fermented in both amphora and neutral French oak, whole-cluster pressed, this is a light, balanced and floral white from the cool appellation, layered in medium-bodied flavors of green apple and apricot. It shines in lovely acidity and just enough weight.                      Virginie Boone
Name: DRNK 2018 Morning Sun Vineyard Pinot Gris (Bennett Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Even with a price increase this remains a top tier, superb value in Oregon Pinot Gris. Rich, concentrated flavors of Meyer lemon, Honeycrisp apple and peaches with a splash of cream dive deep down through the palate. The intensity is further amped up by perfectly pitched acids, thanks to no malolactic fermentation.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Cardwell Hill 2018 Estate Bottled Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a lovely, lively wine loaded with the flesh and skin of Anjou pear, plus green melon and apple. It's bracing and delicious, with freshness and a vivid, acid-driven mouthfeel. The fruits fairly burst in the mouth. Drink this beauty over the next two years.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Lange 2018 Classique Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This delicious ros√© is all Pinot Gris, fermented and aged in a mix of amphorae, concrete egg and neutral oak. Whether you consider it an unusually dark white wine, a ros√© or an orange wine, it is undeniably delicious. A bright copper color, it's packed with bold flavors of orange and pear liqueur. Slightly oxidized and already a year older than most ros√©s, it will reward near-term drinking with floral-citrus aromas, lushly ripened fruit and a finishing hint of toast.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Authentique 2017 Leisure Skin Contact Pinot Gris (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of peach, chamomile, lemongrass and wax make for a complex entry to this bottling. The palate combines lemon-spray and melon flavors, all wrapped in a sleek texture.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lumen 2017 Sierra Madre Vineyard Pinot Gris (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The reserve is more serious than the Classique, with less front-loaded fruit and more details of citrus and mineral. Fermented in neutral puncheons and partially aged in concrete egg, it's juicy and tart, with more apple rind than flesh as the principal fruit.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Lange 2018 Reserve Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Seared lime, melon rind and wet stone show on the nose of this bottling. There is refreshing crispness to the acid-driven palate, where limey flavors are wrapped in a chalky tension and finish with a hint of flint.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Sinor-LaVallee 2018 Pinot Gris (San Luis Obispo County)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This aromatic wine entices with scents of graham cracker, honey and beeswax. Lovely in the mouth, it brings ripe apple, pear and highlights of clover and honeycomb. The length and texture are exceptional.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Fullerton 2018 Three Otters Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This wine is replete with bright flavors of lemon, lime and grapefruit. Accents of spicy white pepper and citrus oil add texture and length.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Left Coast 2018 The Orchard Estate Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Ripe and lively apple and pear flavors seem to light up this medium-bodied, fresh and well-balanced wine. It has a citrus tang supporting peach and crisp apple notes, and will be a perfect aperitif or pairing with seafood.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Navarro 2018 Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)

Description: This widely available wine offers immaculate fruit flavors of apple, pear and melon that carry through to the full-bodied palate. It shows impeccable balance from bright acidity and nice length.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: A to Z 2018 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A fruit-powered wine, this is loaded with apple, melon and pear, and dusted with a dash of white pepper. A suggestion of fresh tarragon adds depth, though taken as a whole it's a wide-open, generous wine that should be enjoyed over the next couple of years.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Alexana 2018 Terroir Series Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is an extra spicy, barrel-fermented and lees-aged wine that adds hints of ginger, butter and vanilla to the naturally fruity flavors of the grapes. Medium to full body and a rich creamy texture give it a mouthfilling presence.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Saint Gregory 2016 Pinot Gris (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A light, clean, fresh wine, this opens with scents of calla lily, then brings light pear fruit flavors with a touch of almond. It's perfect as an accompaniment to light seafood dishes, with plenty of acid and a spicy kick to the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Carlton Cellars 2018 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Van Duzer Corridor, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A nice effort, fresh and leesy, this fills the palate with clean pear and apple fruit. It has nice texture as well, as the wine continues into a medium-long refreshing finish tinged with Mandarin orange and citrus rind.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Ch√¢teau Bianca 2018 Pinot Gris (Van Duzer Corridor)

Description: This Pinot Gris remains on its skins for three months, resulting in a salmon hue. It bursts with aromas of cherry, blossoms, watermelon and fistfuls of fresh herbs. Crisp, tart and textured, this combination carries through to the finish.                      Christina Pickard
Designation: Airlie Bank Gris Fermented on Skins
Name: Punt Road 2018 Airlie Bank Gris Fermented on Skins Pinot Gris (Yarra Valley)

Description: The aromas pop, with notes of kiwi, flowers and nectarine. Off-dry drinking kiwi and pineapple flavors follow, with enough acidity to stand it up straight. It's a sure-fire crowd-pleaser.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Cloudveil 2018 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pear and apple aromas are followed by full-bodied, textured, drawn out flavors. It's a spot-on example of the variety.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Tamarack Cellars 2018 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Clements Hills, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Fragrant and floral in aroma and flavor, this medium-bodied wine is packed with dramatic rose-petal, apple and peach-skin nuances. Made with 48 hours of skin contact, the wine's texture is lightly gripping and appetizing which fits the extroverted nature of the wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Anaya 2017 Potrero Vineyards Pinot Gris (Clements Hills)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of Ruby Red grapefruit pith, citrus spray, lily and a hint of riverstone show on the nose of this bottling from an extremely coastal, oceanview vineyard. The palate is ripe with nectarine, pear flesh and lychee flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Derby 2016 Derbyshire Vineyard Pinot Gris (San Luis Obispo County)

Description: Guava, pineapple and lemon-lime flavors make for a fleshy, brightly layered expression of this white variety, rare in these parts, which is bustling in acidity and low in oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Folie √† Deux 2018 Pinot Gris (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Nicely fruity with fresh flavors of apple and pear, this is a solid example of the grape, the vintage and the style. Balanced with ample acidity, it adds touches of citrus peel and fresh lime to the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Laurelwood 2017 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: A relatively austere expression of this grape variety, this wine starts out with quiet notes of green-apple skins and white spice. Soft florals, nuts and slightly reductive salty characters are there too. The mouthfeel has a lovely talc-like texture, sliced through with crunchy acidity and a yeasty, spiced apple nuance.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Punt Road 2018 Pinot Gris (Yarra Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Watermelon, cherry Jolly Rancher and bubblegum aromas lead to full-feeling sour cherry flavors. It's a bit weighty feeling but still delivers plenty of appeal.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Julia's Dazzle 2018 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: From a normally strong producer, this Northern Tasmanian Pinot Gris is reductive at the moment. Underneath all those oniony aromas are quite pretty aromatics: ripe peaches, pears and florals. But the reduction continues on the palate where it acts like a blanket, suppressing the stone and citrus fruit and slippery texture. Give this plenty of time in decanter or swirling in glass for it to reveal its usual charm.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Holm Oak 2017 Pinot Gris (Tasmania)

Description: A crowd-pleaser, this delicate, aromatic Pinot Gris displays lots of varietal character: sun-ripened red apples and pears, orchard blossoms and lime leaf. It's creamy, bright fruited and would find a happy home alongside a steaming bowl of Thai red curry.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Innocent Bystander 2017 Pinot Gris (Victoria)

Description: The immediate impression is of a wine with intense, penetrating flavors of pear and apple fruit. As it winds down through the finish, there's a bitter, medicinal streak that just won't go away; otherwise, it's a strong and flavorful wine.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: William Rose 2018 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: Smoke, lemon zest, bitter almond and rich notes of dried pear and peach combine into a complex nose. The palate of this wine is lusciously sweet but that richness is countered by exquisite bitter-almond and peach-stone notes. Freshness helps accentuate the viscous mouthfeel of this concentrated, layered and powerful wine. The finish recalls the purest candied peach.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Designation: Clos Saint-Th√©obald Rangen de Thann Vendanges Tardives Grand Cru
Name: Domaine Schoffit 2016 Clos Saint-Th√©obald Rangen de Thann Vendanges Tardives Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Ripe but aromatic pear notes show on the nose of this wine. On the palate this pure fruit is held in a firm frame of phenolics and freshness that channel the concentration and drive of this wine with pure energy. The finish is off dry and lasting. Drink 2025‚Äì2040.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Designation: Clos Saint-Th√©obald Rangen de Thann Grand Cru
Name: Domaine Schoffit 2017 Clos Saint-Th√©obald Rangen de Thann Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A flinty note of reduction still hovers above the nose of this wine. Concentrated and energetic, the drive is full of drive and urgency. The midpalate is all about phenolic structure and a tone reminiscent of apple pip and almond skin. The finish is dry and intense. More will be revealed from this still-disclosing aromatic canvas. Drink 2025‚Äì2040.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Designation: Clos Saint Urbain Rangen de Thann Grand Cru
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2017 Clos Saint Urbain Rangen de Thann Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Apple pip, rich pear, shortbread and spirity lift on the nose make for a heady opening. The palate of this wine shows ripe pear tempered with lemon freshness and purity, fine concentration and that lovely, phenolic bitter-almond streak that lends firm structure. The finish is dry and lasting.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Domaine Riefl√©-Landmann 2017 Steinert Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Notes of ripe yellow pear are edged with honey and lemon zest on the attractive nose of this wine. The palate delivers what the nose promised. Pear, lemon and honey unite in a luscious fashion, with further highlights of candied lemon, bitter almond and marzipan. Although this wine is very sweet it strikes a wonderful balance with freshness. The finish is long and mouthwatering.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Designation: Brand S√©lection de Grains Nobles Grand Cru
Name: Armand Hurst 2017 Brand S√©lection de Grains Nobles Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Almost overripe notions of juicy pear dominate on the nose of this wine. The palate brings in baked pear and nutty shortbread to add aroma and richness. A lovely phenolic texture underpins this generosity with earthy, pleasant bitterness. Power and energy continues to the just-about-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Armand Hurst 2017 Brand Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Creamy, rich but pure notes of pear crumble rise from the glass. The palate of this wine honors these notions with a medium-dry opening that showcases baked, tart pear with its juiciness along with nutty accents and an edge of phenolics. Balancing freshness pervades everything.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2017 Eichberg Trois Ch√¢teaux Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Freshly cut, juicy, ripe yellow-pear notes on the nose almost have a floral overtone. The palate of this wine shows the same intense juiciness of rich pear. A pleasantly bitter phenolic edge lends structure, with edges of marzipan. Concentration and mouthfeel dominate the long, dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Domaine Loew 2016 Engelberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Rich, ripe notes of pear on the nose of this wine almost have a tinge of maple syrup. The palate celebrates this generosity with medium sweetness that accentuates the fruit. It is balanced by citrus freshness and contained by pithy, textural phenolics. Hints of beeswax and spice lend extra interest on the long finish.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Gustave Lorentz 2012 Altenberg de Bergheim Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Hints of both ripe yellow and dried pear play on the rounded nose of this wine. The medium-sweet palate immediately boosts the fruit notions, but they are countered with a pithy, phenolic structure that lends shape and drive. The finish is rich, fresh and long.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Domaine Charles Frey 2017 Frankstein Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Fresh, baked and dried pear appear in a trinity that suggests mellow sweetness. The palate of this wine keeps this promise and adds a fragrant, phenolic edge that is almost reminiscent of spruce, lending unusual but fitting freshness to this rich pear confection. The finish is harmonious, off dry and vivid.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: F. Mallo et Fils 2015 Vieilles Vignes Rosacker Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Gentle but pure notes of ripe pear on the nose become intense and expansive on the palate of this wine. A concentrated body frames the generous fruit with firm phenolics and welcome freshness. The finish is rich, textured, round and dry.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Boeckel 2017 Zotzenberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Ripe, juicy, yellow plums and mellow pear are suggested on the generous nose of this wine. The palate then explodes with medium-sweet notions of ripe, yellow plum. A lemony edge lends freshness but the fruity exuberance is barely contained and lasts joyously throughout the fresh but sweet finish.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Domaine Fernand Engel 2016 Gloeckelberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Notes of fresh- peeled pear are pristine on the nose of this wine. The palate adds fruity sweetness but balances it with lemon freshness, resulting in a medium-sweet, bright and pear focused wine. It finishes pure and long.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Domaine Fernand Engel 2017 Gloeckelberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: An earthy rounded ripeness hovers on the nose of this wine that is dominated by ripe pear. Hints of pear peel adds pithiness. The palate expresses the pear fruit fully and adds a pleasantly bitter edge of almond. This is concentrated, structured and juicy through the off-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Domaine Roland Schmitt 2017 Altenberg de Bergbieten Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A touch of reduction lends an earthy note to the nose of this wine but underneath fresh, ripe pear becomes apparent. The palate brings out the full force of the juicy fruit. It has alcoholic warmth, a pleasantly bitter phenolic backbone and real concentration. Even the extended finish is juicy with pear.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Kirrenbourg SAS 2016 Schlossberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A sense of rounded earthiness surrounds notes of dried and fresh pear on the nose of this wine, which also has a hint of sultana. An off-dry palate boosts the ripe pear notes that come with a phenolic texture akin to pear peel. The finish is fruity, intense and long with a moreish saltiness.                      Anne Krebiehl¬†MW
Name: Domaine Jean Sipp 2014 Altenberg de Bergheim Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)
